name: azuread-app-role-task
friendlyName: Manage app permissions of an App Registration
description: Use this task to maintain app roles of an existing Azure AD App Registration
helpMarkDown: Only App Roles are allowed for now
author: edulima@gmail.com

inputs.name: environmentServiceName
inputs.label: Environment Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription which will be used to manage the app roles. This service must have the permissions Application.ReadWrite.OwnedBy or Application.ReadWrite.All on the Microsoft Graph API.

inputs.name: servicePrincipalId
inputs.label: Service Principal client id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Client ID of the Service Principal which you want to manage app roles for.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: The operation to perform

options.delete: Guarantee the App Role does not exists

inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose if you wnat to guarantee that an app role exists, or to guarantee an app role does not exists.

inputs.name: value
inputs.label: App Role value
inputs.helpMarkDown: The value of the app role (this will be sent on tokens and will be used by applications).

inputs.name: appRoleEnabledFlag
inputs.label: Is the role enabled?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether the app role is enabled or not.

inputs.name: displayName
inputs.label: Display Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The displayName of the app role, which will be displayed in the Azure Portal, for example.

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: The description of the app role.

inputs.name: allowedMemberTypes
inputs.label: What resources are allowed to this role
inputs.helpMarkDown: What is the audience of this app role. Keep each value on one line. The only acceptable values are 'User' and 'Application'.
